page.title: 09Finedon Changes in Work
page.content: Mulso Junior School made a survey among parents and grandparents of its present pupils.We asked four questions. 1. Do you work in Finedon? 2. If not, where? 3. How do you travel to work? 4. What kind of job do you do? Grandparents were asked to give answers for the time they first began work. The results show a big difference in all respects.86% of grandparents worked in Finedon,mostly in the shoe and clothing factories.These walked to work.Only 28% of parents now work in Finedon,58% work in near by towns,and 14% travel.74% of parents use private transport exclusively to travel to work.Only one regularly uses a local bus.Manufacturing industries account for only 38% of the workers,most parents are in service industries.
